page.title: 06LAW AND ORDER
page.content: One of the major types of crime at Snelsmore common is theft from parked cars.The other is stolen cars and motor bikes being dumped on the common and taken apart for scrap. Snelsmore is patrolled nearly every day and an eye is kept on a number of V.I.P.'s who live off the Wantage Road in the area, such as the Lord Lieutenant of Berkshire and affluent business people who are subject to prowlers. As for country crimes,there are few. In the past 13 years only a few sheep and cows have been rustled and there is no poaching of any of the Mankjack deer. There are no illegal campers allowed to use the common.The local country P.C. broke his leg 8 months ago and because of policing cuts he retired early and the villages are now without their P.C.
